column1: Art Institute of Chicago////OMG the miniatures are the coolest thing ever. Their perfection and tininess harkens the days of my youth getting lost in fantasy gazing into my friends enormous dollhouse
column2: and Wes Anderson movies. There was a blurb posted stating that Wes Anderson loves the miniatures exhibit as well which made me feel super cool while I was looking into these tiny rooms
column3: feeling like a big dork. I'm an ARTIST DAMMIT. Anyway the museum is lovely
column4: a wonderful collection and lots to explore. I dipped in for a few hours but it could easily take a couple days to take in everything. The location is great
column5: there is so much to do nearby. I had to relive one of my favorite moments from Ferris Bueller's Day Off while I was there...
